org.jasig.cas.authentication.support

Interface CasAttributeEncoder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCasAttributeEncoder, DefaultCasAttributeEncoder

    public interface CasAttributeEncoder
    An encoder that defines how a CAS attribute is to be encoded and signed in the CAS validation response. The collection of attributes should not be mangled with and filtered. All attributes will be released. It is up to the implementations to decide which attribute merits encrypting.
    Since:
    4.1
    Author:
    Misagh Moayyed

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,Object> encodeAttributes(Map<String,Object> attributes, Service service)
      Encodes attributes that are ready to be released.

    • Method Detail

      • encodeAttributes

        Map<String,Object> encodeAttributes(Map<String,Object> attributes,
                                  Service service)
        Encodes attributes that are ready to be released. Specifically, this method tries to ensure that the PGT and the credential password are correctly encrypted before they are released. Attributes should not be filtered and removed and it is assumed that all will be returned back to the service.
        Parameters:
        attributes - The attribute collection that is ready to be released
        service - the requesting service for which attributes are to be encoded
        Returns:
        collection of attributes after encryption ready for release.
        Since:
        4.1
